title: Manchester Arena bomb family 'living the best lives they can'
description: Eve Senior's photograph after the Manchester Arena bomb five years ago was seen around the world.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'on the water'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: Femicide: Keeping the memory of murdered women alive with maps
description: Geraldina Guerra tracks cases of femicide in Ecuador and maps victims' lives online so people can learn about their life as well as their death.

title: Special Olympics: Teaching Makaton to help win football medals
description: Liam is non-verbal and communicates with his teammates using a mixture of symbols, signs and speech.

title: Laura Jones: The former grid girl who wants to be a racing driver
description: After starting her career on the track as a grid girl, Laura Jones is set on driving her own car.

title: Afghanistan: Policing faces, bodies and beards on Kabul streets
description: The BBC goes on patrol with the Taliban's "moral police", whose job it is to enforce hard-line rule.

title: Charles and Camilla to star in jubilee EastEnders episode
description: The royals will join the residents of Albert Square for a Platinum Jubilee street party.

title: Ukraine's first lady speaks and a call for diplomacy - round-up
description: Olena Zelenska opens up about the war, and President Zelensky says only talks can end the conflict.

title: Title, top four and relegation to be decided - Premier League set for dramatic final day
description: BBC Sport takes a detailed look at everything at stake at the top, bottom and everywhere in between on the Premier League's final day.

title: Australia election: Anthony Albanese leads Labor to Australian election victory
description: A veteran politician, Anthony Albanese will lead the first Labor government in almost a decade.

title: Premier League: How to follow final day - plus watch goals from seven matches
description: How to follow the Premier League's final day on the BBC, including watching goals from seven matches.

title: Spain eases Covid entry rules for UK travellers
description: UK holidaymakers without a jab will be allowed entry with a negative test or proof of recovery.

title: 'Amazing questions! - Kids grill England boss Gareth Southgate
description: England boss Gareth Southgate joins the Football Focus team on the road in Sheffield, where he is grilled by children about life as the men's national team manager.

title: Moldova should be equipped to Nato standard, says UK's Truss
description: The foreign secretary says smaller nations should be helped to counter Russian aggression.

title: Little Oakley football fan dies weeks after stand named after him
description: Gordon Carter was a loyal supporter of Little Oakley FC for 70 years.

title: Manchester Arena attack survivor finally 'happy and healthy'
description: Five years on from having to learn how to walk again, Freya Lewis is now preparing for a charity 10k.

title: Sue Gray met PM to discuss photos being included in report
description: The final report about alleged lockdown breaches in Downing Street is set to be published next week.

title: Tornado in Germany injures 43 people, police say
description: Officials said the tornado cut a path of destruction during violent storms in the west of the country.

title: HRT swaps to fix supply shortage for UK women
description: Pharmacists will be able to give suitable replacements, without needing a brand new prescription.

title: Indiana Jones fan's Suffolk treasure find 'largest' Claudius reign hoard
description: Experts say George Ridgway's find may be the biggest precious metal hoard from Claudius I's time.

title: Dying of cold on the streets of São Paulo
description: A deadly cold snap hits Latin America's biggest city as the number of homeless people grows.

title: US PGA Championship: Will Zalatoris opens one-shot lead
description: Will Zalatoris will take a one-stroke lead into the weekend at the US PGA Championship as Rory McIlroy fades on day two.

title: Parliament could burn down any day, says Andrea Leadsom
description: Andrea Leadsom says MPs need to "get on" with the project to renovate the building.

title: Cost of living: The Ipswich man who feeds his dog rather than himself
description: Brian Turner, who lives alone after the death of his partner, is trying to live on £642 a month.

title: Self-scan supermarket tills and the rows over their use
description: Do you relish scanning your own groceries or are you missing the human cashiers?
